title: Pseudocode
summary: Pseudocode refers to code-like syntax that is generally used to indicate to humans how some code syntax works, or illustrate the design of an item of code architecture. It won't work if you try to run it as code.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
